Yes, both Freedom and RescueTime allow you to set specific goals to reduce your social media usage and track your progress. Here's how:

**Freedom:**

1. **Goal setting**: In Freedom, you can set a custom goal to limit your social media usage. To do this, go to the "Goals" tab and click on "Add a Goal."
2. **Select social media apps**: Choose the social media apps you want to track, such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or any other app you want to limit.
3. **Set a daily limit**: Set a daily limit for the amount of time you want to spend on social media. In your case, you can set a limit of 2 hours (120 minutes) to reduce your usage by 30 minutes.
4. **Track progress**: Freedom will track your social media usage throughout the day and display your progress towards your goal.
5. **Alerts and blocking**: When you reach your daily limit, Freedom will alert you and block access to social media apps for the remainder of the day. You can customize the alert settings to receive notifications when you're approaching your limit or when you've reached it.

**RescueTime:**

1. **Goal setting**: In RescueTime, you can set a goal to limit your social media usage. To do this, go to the "Goals" tab and click on "Add a Goal."
2. **Select social media activities**: Choose the social media activities you want to track, such as "Social Media" or "Entertainment."
3. **Set a daily limit**: Set a daily limit for the amount of time you want to spend on social media. In your case, you can set a limit of 2 hours (120 minutes) to reduce your usage by 30 minutes.
4. **Track progress**: RescueTime will track your social media usage throughout the day and display your progress towards your goal.
5. **Alerts and notifications**: When you reach your daily limit, RescueTime will alert you with a notification. You can customize the alert settings to receive notifications when you're approaching your limit or when you've reached it.

Both Freedom and RescueTime offer flexible goal-setting features that allow you to customize your goals and track your progress. By setting a specific goal to reduce your social media usage by 30 minutes, you can stay focused on your goals and develop healthier habits.
